Token.Abstract: TestFlight object All methods are class level

Add custom environment information If you want to track custom information such as a user name from your application you can add it here. NB: This information must be added before the session starts, it is recorded only on session start.

Parameter.Name: information
Parameter.Abstract: A string containing the environment you are storing

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: The key to store the information with

Token.Abstract: Starts a TestFlight session using the Application Token for this Application

Parameter.Name: applicationToken
Parameter.Abstract: Will be the application token for the current application. The token for this application can be retrieved by going to https://testflightapp.com/dashboard/applications/ selecting this application from the list then selecting SDK.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: NSDictionary containing the options you want to set. Available options are described below at "TestFlight Option Keys"

Token.Abstract: Track when a user has passed a checkpoint after the flight has taken off. Eg. passed level 1, posted high score. Checkpoints are sent in the background. Note: The checkpoint is logged synchronously (See TFLog and TFOptionLogOnCheckpoint for more information).

Parameter.Name: checkpointName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the checkpoint, this should be a static string

Token.Abstract: Submits custom feedback to the site. Sends the data in feedback to the site. This is to be used as the method to submit feedback from custom feedback forms.

Parameter.Name: feedback
Parameter.Abstract: Your users feedback, method does nothing if feedback is nil
